titles.title: A joint resolution granting the consent of Congress to the International Emergency Management Assistance Memorandum of Understanding.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6405-6406)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Leahy without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 397.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Crowley moved to suspend the rules and pass the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S.J. Res. 13.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

bill.summary: 12/26/2007--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Grants the consent of Congress to the International Emergency Management Assistance Memorandum of Understanding entered into between the states of Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Connecticut and the provinces of Quebec, New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island, Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland.
